metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14378 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: ip_reass in ip_input.c in libslirp 4.0.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow via a large packet because it mishandles a case involving the first fragment. It was discovered that a heap-based buffer overflow existed in the SLiRP networking implementation of QEMU. A local attacker in a guest could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code in the host.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> located in slirp/src/ip_input.c in qemu

criterions.comment: basilisk2 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
bochs package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
fs-uae package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
libslirp package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.0-2').
qemu package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-1ubuntu1').
slirp package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
slirp4netns package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.2-1').
vde2 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
xen package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
